title.rendered: One Young World Sandoz Scholarship 2025 [Fully Funded; Nov 2-6; Age-group 18-30]: Apply by March 28

content.rendered:
Applications are invited for the One Young World Sandoz Scholarship 2025. The application deadline is March 28, 2025!

About One Young World Summit 2025

The City of Munich is set to host the One Young World Summit in 2025, marking a significant moment for innovation and global leadership. Known for its rich history, vibrant culture, and striking architecture, Munich has established itself as a major international hub for business, technology, engineering, research, and medicine. Home to top universities and numerous multinational companies, the city is a center for world-class science and technology advancements. The Summit will be held from November 3-6, 2025, where over 2,000 young leaders from more than 190 countries will come together at some of Munich’s iconic venues, making it one of the year’s most important leadership events.

About Scholarship

Despite significant medical advancements in recent decades, global disparities in healthcare access and the availability of essential medicines continue to persist, with billions of people still unable to receive necessary medical care. The most recent World Health Statistics report reveals that progress is lagging on key health targets for 2025, including universal health coverage (UHC), preparedness for health emergencies, and the “Triple Billion” targets aimed at creating healthier populations. Immediate action is needed to address these challenges and ensure equitable healthcare for all.

Sandoz, a global leader in off-patent medicines, is deeply committed to advocating for a future where everyone has access to affordable, high-quality medications. The company plays a critical role in sustaining healthcare systems and keeping budgets manageable. Recognizing that innovation and broad system-wide solutions are vital to closing healthcare gaps, Sandoz is proud to support the Sandoz Scholarships 2025, in partnership with One Young World. This initiative aims to bring together an interdisciplinary group of five exceptional young leaders to participate in the One Young World Summit in Munich, Germany, from November 3-6, 2025, as part of the global Sandoz delegation.

The scholarship is designed for young leaders who are addressing systemic barriers to healthcare access or developing innovative solutions to promote equitable healthcare and medicine access in their communities, countries, or globally.

Examples of relevant work may include:

  • Innovative digital or AI-driven platforms to reach underserved communities with limited physical healthcare or pharmaceutical facilities;
  • Cutting-edge supply-chain solutions to distribute essential medications in remote and rural areas;
  • Community-based healthcare education and training programmes in underserved communities;
  • Advocacy for critical policy changes that make healthcare and medications more affordable and accessible.

Selected Scholars will receive

  • Access to the One Young World Summit 2025 in Munich.
  • Hotel accommodation in a private room between 2 – 6 November 2025 (inclusive)
  • The cost of travel to and from Munich (economy class)
  • Catering which includes breakfast, lunch, and dinner (provided by the hotel and during the Summit)
  • Cost of transportation between airport and hotel via public transport
  • Participation in Sandoz-hosted sessions for their delegation in the lead-up to and during the Summit, and a Sandoz “buddy” to enhance networking and engagement.

Eligibility and Selection Critieria

  • Aged 18 – 30*.
  • Evidenced commitment to delivering positive change
  • Demonstrated capacity for leadership
  • Understanding of key local and/or global issues
  • Track record of generating impactful and innovative solutions to address healthcare disparities or promote universal access to pharmaceuticals. Relevant examples of impact include:
  • Innovative digital or AI-driven platforms to reach underserved communities with limited physical healthcare or pharmaceutical facilities;
  • Cutting-edge supply-chain solutions to distribute essential medications in remote and rural areas;
  • Community-based healthcare education and training programmes in underserved communities;
  • Advocacy for critical policy changes that make healthcare and medications more affordable and accessible.

*Most delegates are between the ages of 18 and 30. The One Young World team will consider applications from those older than 30, pending a demonstration of appropriate personal impact, initiative, and willingness to engage. We are not able to accept applications from those who will be under 18 at the time of the Summit.

March 28, 2025
